Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, great location”
Reviews.Author: OspreyElephant
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, and am coming back after a quick trip to Brussels. This hotel is in a perfect location, the staff are wonderful, room is nice, bed was Very comfortable, all great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, price”
Reviews.Author: EB1199
Reviews.Content: This small (38 rooms) hotel is an excellent location just south of Blvd.St. Germain. Very easy to get anywhere in Paris by Metro or Bus. It is a 3-star hotel with reasonable prices for Paris, but it has all the modern equipment of a 4 star hotel, now including free Wi-Fi in all the rooms (in the past, there was only plug-in internet in the rooms). There is no restaurant, nor should there be with everything from Michelin 3-star palaces to classic local bistros to upstart young hot-shot chefs within 10-15 minutes. As all of the other reviews have said, the staff is very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: PosieH
Reviews.Content: Set in a fantastic location. This hotel is gem. Rooms are chic but very small. Free Wifi, fantastic continental breakfast. The hotel does not do lunch or dinner, but there are many wonderful eating experiences within 150 meters. Lift is smallest on record would not suit wheelchairs.

Reviews.Title: “Pas de Hotel Pas de Calais!!!!”
Reviews.Author: richard m
Reviews.Content: The pictures on their site are not representative of their rooms. This is a 1 STAR hotel, at best. There are no services. No porter. No turn-down service. No Internet capability in rooms. The petit dejuner is NOT included in the room charge, and is a major surprise for its quality. Smoke permeates the building as does the odor of disinfectant and DDT! A plus are the staff. They are pleasant and accommodating. Also, the location of the hotel is excellent. All in all, this was the worst hotel I have ever reserved in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ToscatheCat
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, and have now stayed here many many times. It's ideally located on just 50 metres off the Boulevard St Germain, half way between the Rue du Bac and St Germain des Pres Metro stations. The hotel does not have a restaurant but does provide a very good breakfast. Don't be put off by the lack of dining facilities, there are literally dozens of restaurants and bars within a 5 minute walk. The hotel does however have a bar with a good selection of reasonably priced drinks all of which can be consumed in the pleasant lobby/bar area. There is very good free wifi in the bar and lobby area, and ironing facilities are available on request. The rooms are clean and air conditionned. The best thing about this hotel however is the staff. They are all so friendly and welcoming, it's a pleasure to stay here. For Paris, this is a very reasonably priced hotel, and I would have no hesitation in recommending it on TA.

Reviews.Title: “"Very good!"”
Reviews.Author: brazilian_tourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very good area of Paris. Walking distance to Notre Dame Church, Louvre Museum and Orsay Museum. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Wi fi available in the lobby and wired connection is provided in the rooms. Rooms located in the back area of the building are not reachable by elevators. If you have many suitcases, try not to be in such rooms, as you will have to carry them all the way to your room.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: bougainvillababe
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms are very nice. Friendly staff. With Elevator access

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: Menifeemonkey
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Left Bank, just off the Blvd St. Germain; four minute walk down to the Seine and the Louvre, 10 mins stroll along the river to Notre Dame. Used to stay here on business some 10 years ago and also stayed a couple of times with my wife in 2003 & 2005. Liked it then, for its classic French-ness (yeah, I know that's not a real word, but it fits) - quaint, tiny elevator, open courtyard, charming reception staff. The only down-side was the classic but pokey and tired French bathrooms. But not any more! They've been re-modelled and upgraded! They're now great, with modern and very stylish,high quality fittings. Love it! Decent bathrooms are rather high on my wife's wish-list when it comes to accommodations, and these really check that box. The breakfast area/courtyard has also been updated and turned into a pretty little atrium, with a beautiful "living wall' of plants. Like a little oasis in the middle of a busy Paris. Beautiful! All the other stuff you expect from a decent hotel are there, cleanliness, polite service, comfortable beds, quietness at night, etc. Indeed, the front-desk personnel are really charming and helpful and, if you struggle a bit with your French, don't worry, they all speak excellent English. All in all, an excellent place to stay, at a reasonable price (well, it is Paris, after all, so nothing's really bargain-priced, is it!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelaroundw
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel pas de Calais last week. The location of the hotel is perfect: saint Germain des pres. We found everything we need in this area. There is a lot of good restaurant and bar. We tried the very famous "Ralph" for our birthday and it was amazing! The staff of the hotel is very friendly and helpful and I totally recommend hotel pas de calais

Reviews.Title: “Definitively this is the Hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TABETX
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris many times in the last ten years, but never seen a good Hotel like this one! Very five star location, inside the heart of Paris, très chic, and with a very comfortable and couzy ambient! The owner is a very kind person who cares about eventual problems with their guests! I returned there many times since 2006, and definitively this is the best choice in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nice french breakfast. Thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Megs667
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our three nights at this hotel. We had three rooms booked, which were all spotless and charming. They were actually quite roomy for french standards and had nice touches. The breakfast room/foyer was also nice and light and peaceful, with free wifi. Our room looked onto an internal courtyard, so there was no street noise. However, the only negative was that the walls were very thin, and the guest in the room next to us had their television playing at an extremely high volume for a day and a half. We had to complain three times to management, who responded well and asked the guest to turn the television down multiple times (they refused, but at least the hotel tried). Otherwise , would have been a perfect stay! If your budget can extend to this hotel, book it!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, but no place for taxis to stop in front”
Reviews.Author: CondorcetMonaco
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet, nice lobby, friendly but not overbearing staff, excellent breakfast, all in all a good place to stay in the heart of Saint Germain; The bill was without surprise; The main drawback is the lack of space for taxis to stop in front of the hotel, which is a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, well-located and above all well-priced”
Reviews.Author: Lonetraveller24
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying here - two steps from everywhere I want to be in Saint Germain. The staff are always friendly and helpful, the rooms are correct for the price. I really cannot criticise anything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find.”
Reviews.Author: NY_traveler77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Pas de Calais twice, once with my husband in December 2006 and once with my mother in June 2009. I had a terrific experience both times. The staff is warm and welcoming. They were very gracious about my rusty French and were also kind about speaking English to my non-French-speaking husband and mother. The hotel is very clean and quiet; the rooms are small but comfortable. The hotel is close to several Metro stops and is only about a 15 minute walk away from the Louvre and about 20 minutes away from Notre Dame and Saint-Chapelle. Also, St. Germain is a lovely neighborhood with a number of high-end shops, galleries, and cafes. It is an excellent spot for people-watching. Overall, I feel that this hotel gives travelers more of an authentic French experience than the big-box, American chain hotels in more touristy areas, but at the same time it succeeds in making foreign travelers feel comfortable and safe. My only caveat for other travelers is the elevator situation. There is only one elevator and it is very small by American standards -- you can really only fit one person at a time in it comfortably, and no more than two at a time in any event. All of the rooms are easy to reach via a lovely spiral staircase, so the elevator situation was a non-issue for me and my companions on both of my trips, but I could see it as a potential problem if multiple members of your group were unable to handle the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine welcoming hospitality where no request is too much”
Reviews.Author: NACLLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two mid week nights. We had chosen the hotel on spec, but we were delighted by the wonderfully warm welcome. Everyone was very helpful and friendly and down to earth. The hotel is well situated in a quiet street with the useful velib bikes immediately outside. It's a no nonsense hotel - good value for money and we'll make it our hotel of choice for our Parisian stays.

Reviews.Title: “Big and clean room, but noisy heating system”
Reviews.Author: thunderkiss69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location; St. Germain is a beautiful yet expensive neighborhood with lots of cafés, boulangeries and restaurants, which makes it a great place to eat, drink and spend the night. It is close to the metro station, which is also good. The hotel has a simple yet charming reception and the staff is very friendly. It is located on a quiet street, in a charming building. The room is very big for European standards and very clean, with a nice bathtub and shower. But there was one very annoying thing that kept us awake all night: the heating system makes a very irritating sound, as if someone was stomping the ceiling above us. It was very, very, very disturbing. We only thought about it when we were ready to sleep, so we never properly complained to the hotel staff, but I can't see how they'd fix it. Apart from that, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay here and will definitely be back !”
Reviews.Author: Barbara75
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel and as always it has been a pleasure. On this trip we actually stayed at another hotel in the St Germain area (we thought we would try something different). We were dissapointed however and came back to Pas des Calais. They had a number of rooms available. We decided to stay in a room which had not been refurbised however it was perfect - it was very large (for a room in Paris) and it had large windows overlooking the courtyard which allowed plent of light to enter. The location is perfect and so too is the breakfast. I would highly recommend. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The MOST LOVING HOTEL STAFF IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: GlobalRomanTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to the Pas de Calais for business about a week each year for the previous 5 years. Each year's stay has been at least as magical as the last and remarkably more so over the years. The staff have been at the hotel for years, know the guests and treat us as family. From the moment I check in, I am greeted with a warm hug, kiss on the cheeks, chat and one of any of their great rooms. The receptionists are all great especially Valierie in the morning and Laura. They know all, keep everyone happy and accomodate you better than any receptionist in the world. The rooms at the Hotel Pas de Calais are spotless, clean, secure and an oasis from the hustle outside. Mind you, they are not fancy but are most comfortable and cozy. Breakfast is magical. You are pampered with Paris' kindest ladies (be sure to ask for Marika and Jocelyne) serving you the best French bread in Paris, creamy Camberbert, jams, yogurt, fruit, fresh squeezed juice and tea/coffee. The welcoming smile and hugs are worth the breakfast alone. I love them all. During this most recent trip, I had two things happen different than the other trips. I was ill with a stomach virus my first few days. The night clerks (David in particular) made sure I was taken care of, brought me extra blankets and tea. It was comforting to know he was there and a phone call away should I require additional support. It was later in the week my birthday. All the staff wished me happy birthday and when I returned from a day on the town I was astonished to find in my room roses that the staff had purchased on their own (thank you Jocelyne!), a bottle of champagne from the management (thanks Syline) along with snacks and a card. WOW! A double WOW! It's tough getting older in your late 40's but the team at the hotel made sure I felt special that day. These days of mega hotel complexes like the Marriot or Sheraton as well as super luxury hotels like the Four Seasons, have lost the personal touch and run their businesses to maximize their profits. Not at the Hotel Pas de Calais--the managers and staff are all like family and run the hotel like you are part of the family and are welcoming you back home to rest, rejuvenate, feel loved and special. No one does what they do. Trust me. I log over 100,000 air miles a year and stay in plenty of lodging. I can verify that the Hotel Pas de Calais have the Most Loving Staff in the World.

Reviews.Title: “hate the hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Actually I couldnt believe my eyes when I read the reviews about this hotel. Because for us, the hotel (lets say the room) was horrible...First of all in order to see the sky from our room (the room number was 20 something) you needed a telescope..it was looking to the courtyard and it was really dark...plus if you have any neck problems then you 're no way able to see the sky..... the room was not clean...the carpet was really so dirty that was more than disgusting....So were the towels....you need to be colour- blind in order to see those grey towels as white( after been used for 2 decades I guess) plus i cant say the staff on the front desk was nice and helpful,because when we asked for another room they were even rude and was not helpfull at all......... I will never ever go there again.....

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in St Germain”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaVol
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel choice for the St. Germain des Pres area. It is in a great location on a fairly quiet street. The staff is very kind and helpful. Room size is respectable for a 3-star hotel in Paris. My wife and I spent 5 nights there in October 2008, and were overall very satisfied with our stay. Good bathroom. Our only mild complaint was the bed. This hotel has exceptionally hard beds, and pillows, sheets, etc. are not up to modern upscale hotel standards. They need to make some modest improvements in this area. We would still recommend the hotel based on other positive attributes mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: muttonheadNyc
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel with a lovely owner dominique who strive to make the experience as a guest in her house and not a mere customer. we stayed in room 53 which is a loft like atelier with three small terraces one with table and two chairs. room was hot but cooled off later in the day keep the shades drawn slept with the terrace open loved the sounds of the city and the lighting true parisian experience continental breakfast is great and the common are is quite modern and soothing just of st germain no problem to get taxis and close to great shopping and restaurants dues margots lipp and flore would certasinly stay again deal with dominque directly my wife and i adore her just remeber rooms are small but very modern bathrooms are fine and modern hot showers of course

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, intimate and central on the left Bank”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room. It was not great. It was very tired , there was a stain on the head-board and the bathroom was very old and the room smelt. My husband and I looked at one-another and knew that we could not stay. I went down-stairs and informed them. They were very helpful. They moved us immediately to another room , a recently refurbished room. The Bathroom was clean and bright.The room , although small was clean and fresh.We paid an extra 10 Euros to move .Sadly there was no view, except for the internal windows of the other rooms.However, all this said , we hardly spent any time in our room. The rates were very good. The service of the staff was always helpful and warm. The hotel was clean and in such a great area. We never ate break-fast as there were too many interesting places to try all around us. On the day we left, a very sweet manager showed us her favourite rooms. One was a delux and the other 2 were suites. They were fantastic. Spacious, light, beautiful views and all recently refurbished. So if you intend spending time in your room and need a space these are the ones to stay in. The staff were always helpful and the central location you could not beat!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in the St Germain des Pres area”
Reviews.Author: bdimitrov
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 3 hotels in the St Germain des Pres area, and this one is my favorite. The rooms are neat, the service is good, there is free internet that actually works, and the prices are slightly lower than at the nearby Hotel des Saints Peres. As I have stayed here several times in different rooms, I believe that my experience is representative of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, good for basic needs”
Reviews.Author: IPGHK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in a standard double room. I had no problems during my stay & would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a simple place that's convenient for St Germain. But since my room was so basic, even compared to other hotels in the area in this price range, I couldn't really recommend it for anything more. The hotel has a lot of positives. It's in a terrific location for St Germain, a short walk to various metro lines & the Seine, with great shopping & good places to eat on your doorstep; it's literally around the corner from the church. The front desk staff were very friendly. The lobby area is nice, with a wall of greenery & glass sunroof. My emails to the reservation desk were answered promptly; I had pre-booked a room for early check-in, & there were no mistakes. On the downside, my room was very basic. The mattress was thin; there was no really usable drawer space; the main light was very bright; the bathroom was small, felt old, & had funny swinging doors; the paint was peeling; the walls were very thin. The room itself wasn't tiny, but felt shabby. This isn't terribly surprising for Paris, but I've stayed at 3 other hotels nearby at lower prices with better rooms (though some of them had other issues), so nicer rooms in this price range do exist. I would say that the lobby was far nicer than my room. However, it did have a window overlooking the inner courtyard, which was nice & relatively quiet. There is a computer available to guests with paid internet access in the lobby, but no printer, which is an inconvenience. Note that my room wasn't accessible using the lift; not a problem for me, but might be for others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Figz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pas De Calais near the end of May and were there for the finishing of the reconstruction. Like most other reviewers, we were not notified about the work being done, although it didn't affect us in the least as the work was mostly done except for the painting while we were there. The room was very nice and large by European standards. Large bed, well decorated interior and kept very clean. My only complaints were that the bathroom didn't have a closing door, only a swinging style double door, so if your staying in a room with people who aren't your significant other it can be kind of odd. Also the shower had a weird half glass door, so when you showered, water got all over the floor. (We just asked for some extra towels and had no problems really) The only other problem was the stairs! We were on the inside of the building with a window facing the terrace and there was no elevator up to the room. You had to climb a winding staircase, which in actuality made the stay seem more quaint and romantic, but was a pain when carrying luggage. We did not eat breakfast here and the only time we spent in the lobby was while walking into or out of the Hotel so the renovation and painting did not bother us at all. (we wanted to see as much of Paris as we could in only 4 days so there was no time to eat at the hotel) This Hotel is very nicely located and in a great part of town. We walked and took the metro everywhere in Paris and it was very easy. The area directly around the Hotel has many nice restruants and shopping galore. You could easliy spend a day just walking around the local area. One other thing. I have no idea what that thing was in my 2nd picture. I thought it was a bidet but there was no squirting thing. I didn't use it, but I'd sure like to know what it was for!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Shinty
Reviews.Content: The Hotel made us perfectly aware of the re-construction going on in reception area. It was almost complete when we stayed (17th - 19th May). Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. This was my fourth trip to Paris and it was by far the best location, right in the heart of St Germain where you'll find cool restaraunts and bars and great shopping. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Construction Site”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 27 April, and, like the previous reviewer, were surprised to find the entire ground floor of the building to have been ripped out prior to reconstruction. I was even more surprised to learn that my reservation of a junior suite had been 'cancelled' by the hotel without letting me know. Thankfully they had an empty room (Paris on a holiday weekend without a reservation is not a happy thought), though it was rather worn and tired, and seemed to have last been decorated in the 1950's. We checked out the next morning. The location in St Germain is excellent, but I will not be revisiting this property. By the way - building work starts at 8:00 am, so ensure you ask for a room at the top.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: RachelAndSteveUk
Reviews.Content: We have often used Tripadvisor to base our hotel choice on. The reviews for this Parisian Hotel seemed favourable so we booked through Expedia "a Superior Double Room Recently Renovated" for €150 a night. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a plywood front door and a lobby undergoing serious renovation.....think plywood floor, ladders against the wall and exposed wires. We had not been informed of the renovation during the booking process and were very disappointed, especially as our roomrate did not reflect this inconvenience. We held out better hope for our recently renovated room. When we opened the door to our room and saw the state of it we were most upset. The carpet and chairs were stained. The paintwork was scuffed, tiles were missing in the bathroom and the shower room was tiny. Furthermore when examining the hotel tariff a superior double did not seem to be an option. It was definitely not recently renovated! We spent the afternoon wandering the streets of Paris looking for alternative accomodation. We could only find this for the second night of our stay....but from our afternoons research can tell you that there are definitely better value hotels in this lovely area of Paris. There is nothing that we can recommend about this hotel. Please have a look at our photos.

Reviews.Title: “Charming in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Paris and this hotel was by far the best hotel I have stayed in here. The location was excellent - fantastic restaurants walking distance away (including Cafe Flores and Cafe Deux Magot), and shopping. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. There is also a lovely courtyard where you can have breakfast (which is substantial). We loved Paris and would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Meditated nostalgic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I like St-Germain because of its good location. Safe(we found no pickpockets), convenient to move, and charming place. We chose Pas de Calais to stay. We stayed the standard double room on 4th floor (as I requested the room in high floor). An accommodation was exactly the same as shown on the website. The moment we saw the room, we like it very much. It was such a beautiful room much more than we expected. Wide enough, extremely clean, and good sense designed. That quiet noble room would suite for the person who likes meditation such as a philosopher (J.P. Sartre stayed at this hotel). I'm sorry there were regrettable points, too. First, every time we turned on the heater switch(As it was a chilly night), the fuse blowed and blacked out. At the end, the staff brought us a portable heater. The air-conditioning was good, and heating in the winter will be no problem. Second, when we use a shower, sometimes it becomes to supply only very hot water. The change happens suddenly(oh la-la!). Finally I found that it occurs when another room's person use the shower. I think equipments of this hotel are rather old(if you stayed at suite, maybe no problem). However, this hotel has a great charm which makes up for them. For example, it's classical taste, nostalgic atmosphere, and so on. Here, the same staff works every day, so they know each other and their cooperation is very good. Not only that but also they remembered our face. As a result, we were able to communicate well. A front staff reserved the concert tickets for us. It was held In the church "La Madeleine"! We had very good time in the historic architecture. We want to come back, but want a small refrigerator in the room for the foods we procure in nearby market...

Reviews.Title: “A great little charming French owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled in a group of 5 american couples. We loved the Pas de Calais hotel. The warm and friendly owner, greeted us and was extremely helpful to our group. The hotel is well-located on the left bank among the upscale shops and restaurants of beautiful Paris. We booked a larger room, a suite on an upper floor. Our bathrooms were spotlessly clean and the suite a nice large size. One of the couples had the room decorated in red and white cotton toile, which was beautiful. This is a small French hotel and doesn't offer the amenities of a larger hotel, such as a bar, but for what it is, it can't be beat. My husband and I walked the streets of Paris on a prior trip to find a clean, charming small left bank hotel. Pas de Calais fit the bill. The owner delivered flowers to our room on the day we checked out with a note which read, " Pleae know that you are welcome anytime you return to Paris". I would wholeheartedly reccommend this hotel to anyone looking for this type facility. We loved Paris and found the people to be extremely friendly and helpful. For the same money, we choose Pas de Calais over the Hotel Lutecia, which on another trip we found to have dirty rooms and baths and be in worn condition. We would NEVER stay in the Lutecia again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel with a terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: UNC65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Pas de Calais over the New Year's weekend. The hotel was comfortable and extremely quiet, even though it is only a few steps off the Boulevard St. Germain. The location is excellent for both shopping and sightseeing. The truly outstanding feature, however, was the friendly, helpful staff. When we had difficulty booking a restaurant for New Year's Eve, they responded to my emailed plea for help by finding a reservation at Allard, a splendid old bistro. They helped us make reservations at another restaurant when my shaky French proved inadequate. And when my wife came down with a minor infection and needed medication, they made an appointment for her at a doctor's office in the neighborhood.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Pas de Calais
HotelInfo.Address: 59, Rue des Saint-Peres, 75006 Paris, France
